Explorers Hotel at Disneyland® Paris

50 avenue de la Fosse des Pressoirs, 77700 Magny-le-Hongre, France
  • Todos los Países
  • Hoteles en Francia
  • Hoteles en Ile de France
  • Hoteles en Magny-le-Hongre
  • Explorers Hotel at Disneyland® Paris
  • Habitaciones Familiares
  • Piscina Interior
  • Parque Infantil
  • Sala de Juegos
  • Parque Acuático
  • Cuidado de Niños

Descripción

Todas las habitaciones cuentan con TV con canales internacionales y set de té y café. Las habitaciones familiares con capacidad para hasta 6 personas en una habitación también están disponibles en Explorers Disneyland Paris.

El desayuno buffet continental está incluido en el precio para todos los huéspedes del hotel Explorers y los huéspedes también pueden comprar productos completos de desayuno inglés para agregar a su comida. Los 3 restaurantes del hotel ofrecen a los huéspedes una selección de cocina tradicional, pizzas y opciones de buffet. También hay un bar y una tienda en el lugar donde los huéspedes pueden pedir bocadillos como muffins, donas, galletas y bebidas calientes.

Además de la piscina cubierta climatizada con toboganes, también hay un parque infantil de aventuras y una tienda de recuerdos de Disney. Hay conexión Wi-Fi gratuita en todo el establecimiento.

El establecimiento se encuentra a 4 km de la estación de RER Val d'Europe y del centro comercial y a 7 km de la salida 14 de la autopista A4. Aparcamiento gratuito disponible en el sitio.

  • En este alojamiento hay muchas opciones de entretenimiento.
  • Este hotel tiene habitaciones muy amplias disponibles.

Puntuaciones

86Excelente para Niños (Según puntuación 7.8 en booking.com y nuestra IA)

Calidez, descanso y diversión

"El acceso al hotel es cómodo, tanto si vas en coche propio(tienes parking gratuito) o en otro transporte. La habitación fue cálida, la calefacción funcionó genial. Las camas y almohadas son confortables. El baño estaba muy limpio y con calefacción también. Jabón para la ducha y toallas.El desayuno variado y correcto. La piscina es increíble, grande, con toboganes, cascadas, etc, Los niños disfrutan muchísimo.Tiene vestuarios y taquillas."

- 15/10/2017 -

Perfecto hotel para familias con niños.

"Hotel ideal para ir con niños, la piscina climatizada abierta hasta las 11h de la noche es un puntazo. Desayuno correcto pero caótico por la cantidad de gente que ahí se junta. Restaurante a la carta ideal para escapar de la comida basura, todo riquísimo y a buen precio. Camas muy cómodas y habitaciones amplías. Transporte al parque Disney cada 15-20 minutos. Personal amable y correcto."

- 09/10/2017 -

Repetiremos hotel.

"El desayuno muy completo. Ideal con niños. Recepcionista hablaba español. Habitación amplia y limpia, reservada una para 4 personas y nos dieron una de 6. El autobús para Disney pasa cada 15 min. Repetiremos."

- 30/09/2017 -

Un sueño

"La manera de recibirte las habitaciones el complejo de los restaurantes de buena calidad y muy buena comida la piscina con los toboganes y el barco todo es perfecto"

- 29/09/2017 -

El restaurante buffet era algo flojo para la cena.

"El restaurante buffet era algo flojo para la cena. Los desayunos normales, con pago extra por complementos calientes. La piscina estupenda. El bus al parque funciona genial. Da tiempo a volver al hotel a descansar por la noche cuando cierran las atracciones y cenar en el hotel mientras los niños pequeños cansados de todo el día de trotar por Disney se bañan y volver para el espectáculo nocturno"

- 28/09/2017 -

Genial para viajar con niños

"El hotel ideal para viajar con niños. Muy cerca de Eurodisney. Los autobuses que enlazan el hotel con el parque pasan cada 10 min. El desayuno escasito. Si quieres huevos o bacon hay que pagarlo aparte. Tiene una piscina enorme con tres toboganes, uno para niños menores de 4 años y dos mas grandes. El mayor tiene una altura de dos plantas y es super divertido. De los cuatro días que estuvimos uno lo pasamos en la piscina, y fue un día genial. Para comer tienes un restaurante a la carta y una pizzería. Las pizzas están riquísimas, es una opción muy buena cuando vuelves del parque y quieres cenar algo rápido, cierra a las 23 horas. La habitación un poco vieja, pero limpia. El día que nos íbamos teníamos que coger el avión muy pronto y tuvieron el detalle de prepararnos una bolsa con un picnic. En resumen, lo recomiendo, sobre todo teniendo en cuenta el precio que pagamos. La relación calidad precio es buenísima."

- 27/09/2017 -

Genial relación calidad precio e ideal para ir con niños

"las atracciones para los niños muy bien. Las habitaciones cómodas, teniendo en cuenta que solo se va a dormir, las camas muy cómodas."

- 21/09/2017 -

Está muy bien

"Para los niños genial. Buena ubicación, y todo muy limpio. Personal agradable"

- 21/09/2017 -

El hotel es una más que excelente opción para visitar Disney...

"El hotel es una más que excelente opción para visitar Disney con niños. A punto tal que nuestros hijos a veces querían estar más en el hotel que en el parque. Cuenta con un servicio de transfer gratuito hasta el parque que pasa cada 5 a 15 minutos dependiendo del horario. Pero lo más destacable es que todo el hotel está pensado para niños. Área de juegos inmensa, el barco pirata super divertido, video games, y una mención especial a la PISCINA que es verdaderamente única, con sus dos toboganes acuáticos y su barco pirata para jugar dentro. Te proveen de mallas, toallas y todo lo necesario si olvidaste algo (con coste). Un desayuno normal, sin estridencias pero sin ausencias. Posibilidad de comer bien en el hotel, en tres espacios y propuestas diferentes. Camas cómodas, todo preparado para niños. Las compras de Disney pueden ser enviadas sin coste al hotel. Lo volveríamos a elegir sin lugar a dudas"

Hotel cerca de Disney

"Es un hotel cuyo objeto principal es visitar los Parques de Disney, para lo que dispone de una buena ubicación con transporte gratuito y constantes recogidas, que lógicamente se ven colapsado al cierre del parque.La piscina es muy original para que los más pequeños puedan disfrutar de los distintos toboganes. Las habitaciones son temáticas y permite disfrutar toda la familia en la misma habitación, lo que es una ventaja para viajar con niños.Tiene un amplio parking gratuito que permite dejar el vehículo y trasladarse en el autobús del hotel al parque Disney. La zona del hotel es muy tranquila rodeado de cuidados paseos ajardinados, muy próximo a una localidad residencial."

- 18/06/2017 -

Hotel fantástico para papás y niños pequeños.

"El hotel es maravilloso.Muy buena ubicación, a 8 minutos usando los buses de acercamiento. Llegamos en tren ( RER) y el parque está a metros del terminal.Las instalaciones del hotel son fantásticas.La pieza comodisima, sábanas suaves, muy amplias, con camarotes para los niños con decoración de piratas... Mi hijo alucinaba.El desayuno buffet muy rico, completo.... Solo como detalle ... Los huevos ( revueltos, fritos) tenían un costo adicional.Cenamos un día en el buffet del hotel (24 eu adultos y 12 eu niños) muyyyyy rico y variado.La piscina es entretenidisima!!! Tiene toboganes y juegos de agua. La cara de mi hijo impagable. Debes arrendar toallas por 2 eu y comprar trajes de baño tanto a mí esposo como mi hijo estilo hotpants, que venden ahí mismo y valen 10-12 eu c/u.Es un hotel fantástico. Íbamos por una noche y decidimos quedarnos otra noche más.nos encantó!!Es caro comparado a los otros hoteles de europa en lo que habíamos estado, pero vale la pena completamente. Recomendado!!!"

- 19/03/2017 -

Fantastica piscina y zona de juegos de ambientacióm pirata

"La piscina climatizada es fantásti ca, tiene varios toboganes y un barco pirata con muchos chorros de agua... está fenomenal. El horario de la piscina es muy amplio, de 8h de la mañana a 22.30h de la noche. La decoración en general esta muy lograda. La zona de juegos para los niños con un barco pirata está fenomenal. Tambien esta muy bien que tiene un sistema de taquillas gratuito, que si llegas antes de la hora de darte la habitación puedes dejar las maletas con toda comodidad e irte a Disney y volver mas tarde. Y tambien puedes usar la piscina antes de la hora de entrada y tambien cuando ya has tenido que dejar la habitacion. Mi hija disfrutó muchísimo con la piscina y la zona de juegos.El autobus a Disney es gratuito y pasa con bastante frecuencia. Y el desayuno yo lo encontré muy completo, muchas cosas para elegir aunque un poco "de batalla", la comida no era de mucha calidad, excepto la bollería que estaba buenisima.Las habitaciones no estan mal... se nota un poco desgastadas las moquetas, los baños antiguos... pero todo muy limpio y la cama muy cómoda. La calefaccion funcionaba perfectamente, la temperatura en la habitación perfecta."

Cercanía a los parques, diversión para los niños a buen precio.

"Excelente ubicación para ir al parque de Disney, ya que su cercanía hace que cojas el bus y te deje en 5 minutos. Por contra, al volver del parque es el segundo hotel en el que para, por lo cual es ideal. Las instalaciones para los peques sin ideales. La piscina que es increíble, hace que no quieran salir de allí. También hay un parque de bolas grande. Ambas instalaciones son libres.Nosotros cenamos un par de veces allí, en una pizzería que tiene el hotel. Estuvo bien y los precios son contenidos. También tienes la opción buffet y un restaurante a la carta, pero no puedo opinar.El precio está muy bien."

"Swimming pool and kids pirate ship were very good. My son enjoyed very much."

- 10/07/2018 -

I enjoyed the stay due to fact we were never there as we...

"I enjoyed the stay due to fact we were never there as we booked for 3 days which was plenty for the hotel stay but not enough for Disneyland. The hotel was dirty the palm trees inside have that much dust the trees dropped to the floor. The floor has stains all over carpets where leaks had happened. The room it's self had no fridge and for a family hotel you would expect this due to babies and milk etc. The fan was pointless and noisy. The staff were rude and i can only assume it was because we didn't speak french, except one gentlemen who we cant thank enough for helping us- Cederick @ reception! The pool had that much chlorine it made your skin itch. No lifeguards were seen in the pool area for our whole duration it was like a zoo which was so dangerous. Kids of 3 -4 years old come flying down slides with other kids in tow people at bottom of slides. I saw and experienced a few near misses myself . The shuttle service and location of hotel was amazing could fault it every 20 mins and 10 mind away from Disney. The food however was not so great. This hotel needs some TLC"

Breakfast was like kindergarden.

"Breakfast was like kindergarden... Lots of children etc. but better than we expected. BE SURE to take drinks, water, soft drinks etc with you. If you have cooler, that will be fine. NO fridge in the room! Small water bottle in the hotel was 2,70 euros and Coke 3,70... IN THE AUTOMAT!!!! Food was expensive in the hotel too. But it is close to the Disneyland, maybe that is the reason... Pool was really fun for the kids. Bring your own towels, or rent them from the Hotel... Strange that no hotel room towel allowed to the pool area... Bus trip to DLand works well."

- 28/06/2018 -

A great stay a few minutes from Disneyland

"We enjoyed staying at the Explorers, it is just a few minutes ride to Disney and the kids loved the pirate theme of the hotel. The room was very nice but for us the room was a bit too crowded as it had both a bunk bed and a double bed but we also had an extra bedroom attached with a bunk bed attached (our room could accommodate 6 people but we were only 4) which gave both our kids the option to sleep on the top bunk which they always fight over.Even though we thought we would only be in Disney and would not use the pool as it was very hot outside our kids spent both evenings at the pool and the slides and in some ways they enjoyed it even more then Disney!"

Great family hotel . Pool was great and plenty to entertain the kids . Highly recommend

"Reception Staff where very accommodating and friendly . The pool was that good my daughter (7) would have stayed in it all day . Great opening hours aswell as the pool stayed open till 10.30ish . Smaller kids where Kept entertained with the play area and the ship . Would highly recommend this hotel . There’s two things that I could fault tho and the first is the price of alcohol.. a pint of beer €7.50. Anyone going to the parks try attractionx for tickets , hotel was €100 dearer than online . First day we paid €264 for 2 adults a 7 yr & 3 yr old for one park one day . Wasn’t paying that for the second day so went online booked the tickets and hotel printed them out . With attractionx you get 15% off your planet Hollywood meal and fast passes on some rides . Highly recommend that site ✅👍"

- 10/06/2018 -

Great family hotel, everything a child could dream

"It’s a child’s dream hotel! Has everything you need to keep them in one spot and happy. The pool is open late so you can have a swim after dinner or after a day at the park and the slides are loads of fun with kids. The pizza place is also open late for a late night dinner. The kids play area is in the open eating area so you can feel comfortable having a drink whilst they play as you can watch them. The bonus is that practically everyone at the hotel is families so everyone is in the same frame of mind and it’s easy to strike up conversation."

- 22/05/2018 -

Simple accommodation convenient to Disneyland Paris.

"This was a fun place to stay for the two days we were visiting Disneyland Paris. It was, predictably, over-run with kids and "the sort of people who go to Disneyland" (which I suppose we have now become!), and the level of sophistication that that entails. The dining options were quite limited, but we actually found the buffet restaurant fit the bill for us perfectly both nights we stayed there. The pool area was something my daughter had been looking forward to for ages, and it lived up to her expectations. Our room was comfortable and had all the amenities we required, and we were also fortunate enough to be allocated a room on the ground floor (same floor as reception), which was convenient and not noisy as anticipated. The shuttle buses to and from Disneyland were convenient, and run fairly frequently."

- 08/05/2018 -

Fantastic 3 star for families

"I don’t usually book 3 star hotels but chose the hotel due to its child friendly decor and set up and it definitely delivered on that front. There was a lovely pool with a water slide etc as well as a pirate ship and indoor play area. Theme and bunk beds very great. The staff were fantastic. I would like to say a big thank you to the lady who was on the Saturday night shift. My child was ill and she promptly arranged for an ambulance and stayed to translate. She even arranged a late check out for us. If you are looking for a great kids experience without paying extortionate rates then I definitely recommend. If you are looking for adult luxury (Spa’s, room service etc) then this won’t be for you as it has definitely been design with kids at the forefront."

Perfect family venue, no need to leave the site. Comfy bed, abundant food choice, good beer!

Window opens. Quiet in the room. Had a great meal at Captain Library & fairly fast but decent pizza in the food hall the 1st night. Good micro brew beer (Parisienne) available! A great way to end our tour of Breton/Norman old stuff so the kids were able to enjoy the vacation to its fullest. Didn't even do Disney, and that meant the pool and activities were all ours during the day!"

- 02/03/2018 -

Great for children

"Super for children - great pool area albeit a bit small (and crowded when we were there), spacious softplay area which was generally clean but a bit smelly in the entrance part (there are carpets and children must have peed there ... they should have laid hard-floors which is easier to clean than carpets, would be more hygienic for kids), for additional entertainment they also have a small video games room, 2 pool tables and "6D" cinema in a dedicated theatre which cost €5 for approximately 6mins. All in all, the communal areas were quite spacious and pleasant and the Reception staff were very nice and helpful. There is a free shuttle for Disneyland and the train station for Paris which runs circa every 15 mins."

Highly recommended

We visited over Christmas and it was very busy particularly in the restaurant in the morning.Rooms were very basic but do you really go to Disney to spend it in the room???Food was ok.....3 star quality as you would expect.My kids loved the pirate ship and the pool and was always excited to go back there after being at the parks.Shuttle comes every 10-15 mins and it was never a problem getting on one from the hotel to the park and we had a double buggy and 3 other children with my husband and I. However getting the shuttle back from the park was an absolute nightmare with many arguments and pushing and shoving taking place to get on a bus!!!"

Baggage locker system for left luggage actually worked quite well, although the room was crowded at peak times. Significantly cheaper than the official Disney hotels, but still fun and convenient."

- 10/08/2017 -

Would recommend

"The facilities are excellent for families, great pool and soft play."

- 10/08/2017 -

Amazing!

"Myself and my 3 young children have just returned from a 5 night stay at the Explorers, and we had such an amazing time. As soon as we arrived on Friday night the kids were straight in the pool, which has 3 water slides and a big pirate head which empties water out from above the pool. It's open until 23.00 so we ended up here every night, even after our busy day. There is also a soft play, an indoor and out outdoor play area as well as a games room, all of which my kids enjoyed and had lots of fun! There is also a 6D cinema, which was great fun. The room we had wasn't massive, but for 1 adult and 3 children it was fine, given we were hardly there. Breakfast is a continental buffet which consists of croissants, ham, cheese, yogurts, fruit salad etc. It can get busy the later you go, so I would recommend getting there as early as you can. I found this perfect for young kids as they can eat as much or as little as they wanted of whatever they wanted. We also went to the buffet style restaurant in the evening which was reasonably priced and had foods such as beef, fish, rice etc as well as delicious desserts. Again this was perfect for the kids and they refused to eat anywhere else. My eldest preferred it to any of the restaurants at the Disney parks.Disneyland and the train station are less than a 10 minute shuttle bus ride away, which picks up in the hotel.It was my eldest child's 10th Birthday during our stay and I paid for a celebration package from the hotel. This included balloons in our room, a soft toy which was the hotels character, sweets and he had a cinema voucher. The hotel also made an amazing cake (see pic) for him and sang happy birthday to him in the restaurant! He was so happy. Thank you explorers hotel! Overall I would highly recommend this hotel for families and would definitely stay again. P"

- 17/06/2017 -

Great hotel for kids!

"Swimming pool with kid's waterpark (pack briefs as they don't allow surfer type shorts), otherwise you can buy them for 8euros from vending machine. Nice outside playground for kids. Basically a great KIDS oriented hotel - kids gym, 6D cinema, kids inside/outside play area, pizza/ice cream/sandwiches and the lot. I would advise couples and families WITHOUT children to stay away from this hotel)) If you are used to quiet, '4 seasons' type hotel with room service - then Explorers hotel is not for you!! Shuttle service to Disney parks was very quick, 5-10 mins wait and less than 5mins ride."

- 16/06/2017 -

Great place for childs

"Indoor swimming pool is the most joyful part for children"

- 16/06/2017 -

Kids had a ball.

"Kids (2 and 7) had an absolute ball here. They rated the hotel better than Disneyland. We were upgraded to a larger room which was nice to have extra space. We had breakfast at 7am when it opened which was fine with a good choice of basic breakfast. The next day we were there at 8.30am and it was chaos - so recommend going earlier. Good luggage storage facilities. We had dinner at the restaurant and the servings were huge. 3 of us could have shared the bowl of spaghetti , which was suitable for kids but not a fancy meal. Also had a burger which was tasty and huge."

- 03/06/2017 -

Great for familly

"Travelling with a family with four children, I found this hotel perfect for our trip to Disneyland Paris, the pool and play areas were excellent, the rooms were large and had everything we needed. The restaurants were a little pricey and breakfast could have benefited from maybe a little more variety, but on the whole couldn't fault it. The free shuttle bus, although a little crowded, got us to the parks and back very quickly with no hassle. I would definetly stay here again and would recommend it to anyone planning a trip to Disney who doesn't want to spend too much on a hotel."

- 22/05/2017 -

Very good "standard" hotel

"The hotel is very close to the Disney Parks, and has a free bus shuttle to and from- hard to turn down! The hotel room was quite large, had a couch, and a fully laid-out bathroom set-up (NOT something you can take for granted around London or Paris). I guess around Paris the toilet is in a different area than the shower- a bit funny but alright. There's a shop on-location, and it's got a bunch of stuff for families (the pool, the play area).It feels very much like a nice, solid, "typical" hotel with some good extras for families- the price wasn't too steep, especially compared to the "authentic" Disney hotels- for only a bit more than I paid to stay in London or Paris, I had a TON of stuff. You pay more than you would in a comparable hotel at Walt Disney World, but only by a bit- and hey, it's Paris."

- 21/05/2017 -

Kids had a great time !

"lot of activities for kids . Pool and 3D theatre was awesome ."

An indoor playground for when parents just want to relax for a little while before heading out and a few different places to eat, we especially loved the pizza! The rooms are pirate theme and have lots of space for families to stretch out after a long day. Their bunk beds are really spacious and our kids loved playing in them."

- 06/04/2017 -

The themed hotel was so much fun for our kids!

"The themed hotel was so much fun for our kids! The value for money was excellent in my opinion, although the quality of some aspects of the hotel definitely seemed 'budget'. Breakfast was great and most of the staff were very friendly and helpful. We forgot swim diapers for our little kids but they sell items like that individually in a vending machine at the pool, which was very handy. (2.50e per diaper, 8e for kids' swim trunks/suits, 12e for adult swim trunks/suits). Our kids loved the indoor play area, too."

"Very child friendly"

- 05/04/2017 -

Fantastic hotel

"The cost of my room hadn't specified breakfast but when we got there it was included which was a huge bonus for five people. I would advise bringing cordial for the kids likes the robinsons shots as only fizzy drinks and pure juices available so handy to have for going to the parks. Shuttle bus so handy and none of the pushing and shoving stories I kept hearing. Magic shuttle dropped us within half an hour of the airport. My Mam had a fall in Disney park requiring quick trip to hospital for a stitch which Disney facilitated but hotel then faxed our European travel card details and passport to hospital to ensure we weren't charged. Really helpful and no trouble to them.The pool was a fantastic asset to the hotel, its the main reason I picked the explorers, the facilities for kids. Men cannot wear loose shorts in pool but trunks available in vending machine in pool area. Also towels available to rent so don't waste space bringing towels the towel can be dried and reused if you wish. It was very relaxed very family friendly very safe. The kids were devastated leaving!"

At meal times there was a good choice of food and lots of it! The pool was brilliant, the children (6 & 8) loved it! Buses to Disneyland were regular. I would definitely stay here again."

Great Service, Location and Facilities

"The facilities for the kids are exceptional, 2 indoor playgrounds,a games room, an outdoor pirate playground and a 6D cinema. The pool had 3 different slides and a pirate ship with lots of activities. Staff at the desk were extremely helpful and very informative. The hotel is the first pick up on the shuttle bus to the park and the first drop off in the evenings. The room had a radiator which we could adjust and a fan on the ceiling if it got too warm. Far exceeded our expectations and great value for money. We will definitely be back."

Pizza at night goodPool and play area great for kids especially after a long day at the park. This is our 4th trip to Disney and 2nd to this Hotel. A cheaper option for families with good facilities but remember you are in Disney and it does cost more than if you stayed outside the Disney resort area and travelled in. The shuttle bus from the parks to the hotel were like clockwork - great service."

- 27/11/2016 -

Nice hotel that kids will enjoy

"Great fun for kids. Swimming pool for the youngest, indoor play park, nice decoration, games and a buffet."

- 27/11/2016 -

great location for DisneyLand

"We stayed here to be close to Disneyland Paris, the price was fair, rooms were very clean and the staff was very polite. They offer wi-fi for free which was nice to check in with people after a day at Disneyland. The shuttle bus '54' runs regularly from the Explorers hotel, it seemed about 15-20 minutes depending on the time and day. One tip to consider when planning your day is the hotel is the first of many stops when going to Disneyland, so the ride takes about 25-30 minutes from pick-up at the hotel to walking through the entrance of DisneyLand. The ride home is much shorter with the bus stopping at Explorers Hotel first, 10 minutes for the ride back to the hotel.The food court was nice, there is a happy hour every day from 7pm-8pm with half-price drinks, so you can get a couple pints for 8 euro's or so. The pizza was good and quick for the kids after a full day in the amusement park. There was other food options in the hotel that were sit down restaurants but we didn't try them. The continental breakfast was good, exactly what you would expect from a european continental breakfast."

- 26/11/2016 -

Comfortable, friendly, family environment

"Very family friendly. Our kids really enjoyed the pool and play areas. The staff was very friendly and helpful as well. The shuttle service to the Disney Parks ran for a long time so it was very convenient going from place to place."

- 26/11/2016 -

Fantastic hotel for families

"Explorer's Hotel is a fantastic hotel for families. My kids (ages 5 and 7) loved it. They had a blast. There is an indoor playground, outdoor playground, heated pool with slides and waterplay. Free breakfast (continental, extra fee for cooked eggs, bacon) was fine. Free wifi, free parking, and free shuttle to Disneyland. Great place to stay and lots of fun to be had after returning from Disney. We would stay here again."

Lovely stay near Disney Land.

"The kids loved the decorated rooms and hotel. It was neat and we had a lovely stay. The free breakfast was also a bonus. The kids loved the play area. There is a free shuttle bus to the park and train station. I took a direct train from there to Paris and back. It is about an hour to the city. The hotel ordered a taxi for us from the airport, but we went back to the airport by train. There is a direct train to CDG airport that only takes 10 min. We checked out early morning, but we could use their facilities for the day till it was time to leave for the airport."

- 06/09/2016 -

Lots for children to do

"Lots for children to do"

- 06/09/2016 -

Perfect trip to Disney the hotel made our holiday even more special.

"Loved this hotel, couldn't believe some of the things people complained about when I was reading the reviews.. Most of the staff speak upto 4 different languages brilliantly, all happy to help of you need anything. Facilities were fab plenty to do once you've come back from Disney. They have a Disney shop, restaurant, bar and even a little pizza cabin that's open until late. Yes people stay up with their children but what do you expect?? You've booked a family hotel with a giant play boat inside of course it's going to be a little busy/noisy. Pool is a little deep so just keep an extra eye on any little ones using the slides. Apart from that everything's clean and well kept. Also a few complained about the heat, you've book a hotel with no aircon in the middle of the French summer of course it's going to be warm. Use your common sense shut the curtains and open the window through the day. I requested a fridge before going and they provided one. Shuttle buses straight to Disney. I would definitely recommend this hotel and stay here again."

"Clean and tidy. Great facilities for young children. Breakfast good."

- 14/08/2016 -

Exceptional hotel, especially in emergency when our child got sick.

"Location was excellent and swimming pool and soft play area excellent for kids. Disney 5mins on a shuttle bus and shopping centre 5mins away. Our son got sick and we had a doctor to our room within the hour. Cost €50, taxi to the chemist cost €5 return. I can't rate this hotel highly enough. Buffet dinner in the evening was lovely."

- 14/08/2016 -

3 funny days at the Disneyland Paris

"Our room with a double bed and 2 twin beds was spacious for one adult and 2 kids. It was clean (towels changed everyday and bathroom cleaned). It was a good decision to have both breakfast and dinner (half-board) at the Plantation restaurant. There was a good variety of food every day. And the most important thing for kids was to have a swimming hour by the hotel's pool every before or day after a funny at Disneyland Parks."

- 12/08/2016 -

- 12/08/2016 -

Kids happy, so I'm happy!

"Hotel was fantastic for kids, the bar/cafe overlooked the pool and the pirate ship so kids could play whilst parents relaxed. Pool was great fun but better for strong swimmers around the end of the slides and noisy at times. Free bus to Disney really frequent and fantastic! Hotel Staff helpful and great family rooms without the need for anyone to sleep on a sofa bed! We were behind the communal space and lift so the free wifi reached our room which was great but it would be better to generally have in all rooms. Staff uniforms reinforced the theme and added to the magic for the kids. Overall good value for money in terms of cost of accommodation and the kids adored it and are desperate to go back!"

- 20/07/2016 -

The best place you will ever stay !

"This is the best hotel I've ever stayed at ! I loved it !!! Went to celebrate my 26th birthday, the hotel pirate theme is so much fun, with carpets that look like the sea !! There great places to eat and a gift shop and pools. The grounds are great form morning walks/runs. The staff were so friendly and helpful, nothing was too much trouble. In fact I bought chocolates on my last day for them to thank them for such great service. There's a free shuttle bus service to Disneyland that arrives every few minutes, it's about a 15 minute ride to the park. Nice an quick ! This hotel is just so fantastic and really good for the money for a Disney hotel. Whether your bringing your kids or coming with your friends or partner - this is the hotel you need to book !"

- 06/10/2015 -

Perfect for our 6-year-old.

"Perfect for our 6-year-old. He loved the water park, the pirate ship and ball park, almost better than Disney itself! The room was comfortable with plenty of storage space, a fun, bright and cheery design and comfy beds. Great to have English channels too even CBeebies! The staff were friendly and everything was kept clean and tidy, despite the number of young kids running around! I wouldn't recommend the buffet (a bit bland and luke warm) but the pizzas weren't bad. Breakfast is a bit chaotic but it's part of the fun and to be expected when you're catering for that many families. Shuttle to Disney worked well (every 15 mins and takes 5). Would definitely recommend it to friends with children under 10 who are going to Disney. The wi-fi worked well too."

- 08/08/2015 -

The hotel is very good for kids, the pool is excellent and...

"The hotel is very good for kids, the pool is excellent and opens from 0800h to 1100hrs, the are two indoor play areas one being a soft play area and an outdoor play area so plenty to amuse smaller children. There is also a games room for older children but children under 12 must be accompanied by an adult. Hotel is quite big and breakfast time is very busy but food is plentiful, cooked breakfasts have an additional charge. Room are compact but suitable and clean with cleaning services everyday. Any staff I dealt with were helpful and friendly. Gift shop prices are the same as Disneyland. Free shuttle bus every 10-15mins to and from Disneyland so all round a great service. Good hotel for 3 star, don't expect 4/5 star service, you get what you pay for but is affordable for families who want the Disneyland experience without paying a fortune."

- 04/08/2015 -

The explorers hotel is child friendly & I will be...

"The explorers hotel is child friendly & I will be recommending this hotel to others with young children!"

- 24/03/2015 -

The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful.

"The staff is extremely friendly and very helpful. My flight got in early and they let me check in a few hours early and I was upgraded to a suite for free. A good amount of the staff speaks English but if you want to try out your french go for it! They welcome it. This is the ultimate hotel for kids and adults from the pool with the 2 water slides and the dry play area for kids inside and outside that they do not advertise. My kids absolutely loved it. For men going to the pool they do enforce the French policy of wearing speedos. They lent me one for free for my son. The staff will also lend you arm floaties for children if you go to the deep end of the pool. As a single parent traveling to this hotel with 3 small children I felt comfortable going around and did not worry about anything."

- 17/03/2015 -

Had a great quick getaway here.

"Had a great quick getaway here. Second time at this hotel and the kids love the pool and 6-D movie theatre!"

- 03/07/2018 -

Gutes Hotel nahe Disneyland Paris

"Das Hotel hat tatsächlich eine sehr gute Lage, um Disneyland mit dem Shuttle Bus oder mit dem Auto (Kostenloses Parken für Hotelgäste des Explorers) zu erreichen. Das Contentintale Frühstück ist völlig ausreichend, wenn auch etwas turbulent. Beschwerden über den Aufpreis für ein Eierfrühstück ist Jammern auf hohem Niveau, da der Aufpreis von 2-3 EUR bei den Gesamtkosten für den Disneyland Aufenthalt verschwindend gering ist. Das Schwimmbad mit zwei Rutschen ist schön und für Kinder spannend gestaltet."

- 02/07/2018 -

Das Dinner im Hotel (Captain's Library) war preislich, in Bezug auf Menge und Qualität, völlig angemessen - nicht zuletzt natürlich auch lecker! Wir haben nichts zu kritisieren."

- 06/06/2018 -

Wir kommen gerne wieder!!!!

"Super schönes Hotel, mit sehr netten Personal.Es hat alles super geklappt, vom Frühstück, Check IN sowie Check OUT.Beim Check IN:Marcel von der Rezeption (super Typ) hat uns alles genau erklärt > Shuttlebus, 6D Kino, Frühstückszeiten, Poolzeiten, wo sich alles befindet.Einfach Klasse!!!!Pool ist sehr nett für Kinder gestaltet und die Außenanlage ist sehr gepflegt gewesen. Frühstück war sehr ausreichend und das Personal hat die Sachen die leer waren sofort wieder aufgefüllt."

- 03/06/2018 -

Für Familien mit Kindern ein Traum

"Es ist ein Paradies für Kinder Hotel ist ganz nach Kindern eingerichtet. Zimmer war sehr sauber. Betten waren gemütlich, man hatte alles im Zimmer was man braucht außer mini bar. Shuttlebus System klappt super man kann es jederzeit in Anspruch nehmen. Frühstück war auch ganz in Ordnung man hatte alles was man braucht. Besonders gut hat meinen Kindern Schwimmbad gefallen die hatten dort Riesen Spaß."

- 30/05/2018 -

Trotz der kleinen Minuspunkte (Aussehen der Anlage selbst, Shuttlebus) sind wir nun zum 3x da.

"Unsere Kinder 4 & 11 sind nach wie vor von den verschiedenen Freizeitangeboten restlos begeistert. Ein Spaßbad mit 3 Wasserrutschen, für unterschiedliche Altersstufen, zwei Spielplätze in Form von Piratenschiffen, eines Innen eins Außen und ein Kletterspielplatz mit Bällebad. Besser geht nicht. Das Frühstück ist ausreichend und gegen Aufpreis gibt es auch Rührei. Standard sind: Brot, Mini Baguette, Croissant, Brioche, Schokobrötchen. Schinken, Käse, Salat, Obstsalat und frisches Obst. Es fehlt also eigentlich an nichts. Die Zimmer sind für 4 Personen ausreichend. Lediglich ein abschließbarer Schrank wäre schön. Die Nähe zu den Parks ist ok, leider nicht so nah, dass man es bequem zu Fuß gehen könnte, was etwas schade ist. Aber dafür gibt es die Shuttlebuse."

- 28/05/2018 -

Trotz der vielen Kinder war es im Hotel, vor allem im...

"Trotz der vielen Kinder war es im Hotel, vor allem im Bereich der Gästezimmer leise. Für Kinder gab es viele Spielmöglichkeiten. Wir können das Hotel wirklich empfehlen."

Super nettes Personal - tolles Hotel für Kinder.

Das Schwimmbad ist zwar kleiner als erwartet gewesen aber trotzdem war unsere Tochter von der Rutsche sehr begeisters. Die Zimmer sind sauber und normal groß. Da wir eine Nacht verlängert haben hat uns der nette Mann von der Rezeption ein anderes Zimmer gegeben was etwas größer war. Der Bus zum Disney Land Paris fährt regelmäßig und ist auch nicht so überfüllt gewesen. Das Essen von der Pizzaria war super und super schnell fertig. Hier kommen wir bestimmt noch mal her."

Sehr teuer.

- 03/08/2017 -

Disneyland immer eine Reise wert, ansonsten enttäuscht

"Das Frühstück war sehr,sehr gut, das Hotel super für Disneylandbesucher,aber nicht für Parisreisende.Warewn im Disneyland,alles grandios!!!!! Fahrt nach Paris kathastrofal, da wir mit dem Kinderwagen(Buggy) unterwegs waren, ließ man uns an der großen Pforte durch.Wir waren 5 Erwachsene, ein Kleinkind, ein Junge 12 Jahre. Dieser ging mit dem Vater und dem Baby durch die große Pforte(ein Officer ließ sie durch, als wir dann mit der U-Bahn weiterfahren wollten, wurden diese 3 Personen(Sohn mit den 2 Enkeln) festgehalten und als Schwarzfahrer bezeichnet, entweder 70,--€ zahlen oder Polizei, obwohl wir die anderen Tickets zeigten, die wir ja alle zusammen gekauft hatten und die nicht abgestempelten, also haben wir bezahlt, aber das ist nicht Touristenfreundlich für Paris!!!!!!"

- 29/07/2017 -

Perfektes Hotel für einen Aufenthalt am Disneyland.

"Das Hotel ist sehr familienfreundlich, der Pool bis 23:00 Uhr geöffnet (und ja, die Kinder haben auch nach einem ganzen Tag Disneyland immer noch genügend Energie...). Das Essen ist passend für Kinder, die Spielplätze, innen und draußen, schön gestaltet. Unser Zimmer war ein Doppelzimmer mit Zustellcouch, ausreichend für 2-3 Personen; der "Kleiderschrank" ist nur für Kurzbesuche ausgelegt. Wir waren im Juli dort und trotzdem haben der Deckenventilator und ein geöffnetes Fenster gereicht, es ausreichend zu belüften und runterzukühlen. Es war schön als Koje "dekoriert" - unsere Tochter war begeistert. Zum Frühstück gab es alles, was man als "Deutscher" braucht - sogar leckeren Kaffee."

- 29/07/2017 -

Besser als erwartet

"Sehr gute Spielmöglichkeiten für Kinder mir Indoorspielplatz und Schwimmbad mit Piratenschiff. Ambiente aber sehr nüchtern und nicht wirklich gemütlich (Plastikstühle und Tische für Eltern im Essensbereich). Dennoch als Aufenthaltsort zum Disneyland Besuch sehr empfehlenswert. Kostenloser Shuttle zum Park fährt regelmäßig bis nachts um 1 Uhr."

- 25/07/2017 -

Tolles Hotel für den Disneylandaufenthalt!

- 11/06/2017 -

Immer wieder ein Vergnügen

"Das Hotel ist ein Traum für Kinder. Mehr geht eigentlich nicht. Schwimmbad mit 3 Wasserrutschen, Bällebad, Aussenspielplatz, Kindergymnastikraum (bitte nicht zu ernst nehmen), Spielhalle (gegen Aufpreis). Unser 2 Aufenthalt dort und für nächstes Jahr schon gebucht. Das Frühstück ist ausreichend Toast, Brot, Joghurt, Obstsalat, Semmeln, Croissants, Käse, Schinken, Salami. Für jeden etwas dabei. Das Hotel ist sauber. An manchen Stellen etwas abgewohnt, aber alles kein Drama. Für Familien mit Kindern absolut zu empfehlen."

Ein sehr schönes familienfreundliches Hotel, immer wieder gern...

"Ein sehr familienfreundliches Hotel in einer ruhige Lage. Bis zum Dysney Land fährt ein Schuttlebus, der in den Zimmer-Preis inbegriffen ist, alle 10-15 min. Fahrtdauer ca. 5-7 min. Das Hotel selbst ist schön und kinderfreundlich eingerichtet, während unseres Aufenthaltes gab es sehr viele Kinder, die Angebote wie innenliegende Pool und Indoorspielplatz wurden sehr gut genutzt...Die Kinder hatten sehr viel Spass..Die beiden Abend- Restarants, waren ziemlich teuer, man könnte aber in der Pizzeria, für etwas preiswerteres Angebot die Abendmalzeiten ersetzen..."

- 24/04/2017 -

Tolles Hotel in dem man auch ruhig so mal Urlaub machen kann. Wunderschön gelegen an einem See.

"Beim Frühstück hat eigentlich jeder etwas gefunden, von Müsli über frisches Obst, Brötchen, Croissants, Schokobrötchen, Marmelade und Nutella, Wurst und Käse -> alles vorhanden!Super war vorallem der Swimmingpool und der Indoor Spielplatz. Unbezahlbar, dass man abends gemütlich einen Cocktail genießen kann und die Kinder können noch ne Runde toben! Aus dem Pool war meine Kleine nicht mehr raus zu bekommen. Das Wasser war angenehm warm, die Duschen allerdings saukalt und nicht zum richtig Duschen geeignet. Toll war auch, dass der Bus wirklich alle 15 Minuten gefahren ist und wir das erste Hotel waren das angefahren wurde. So hatte man immer einen Sitzplatz! Beim Zurückfahren von Disneyland war man dann dafür auch wieder das erste Hotel zum Aussteigen. Unbezahlbar bei schmerzenden Füßen! ;-)"

Die Bus-Anbindung zum Disneyland is absolut super, der Fahrtakt liegt zwischen 5 - 20 Minuten, je nach Uhrzeit. Wir durften am tag der Abreise sogar noch mach dem Check-out ins Schwimmbad gehen, wo sich die Kinder vor der langen fahrt noch mal richtig auspowern konnten. Vielen Dank dafür!"

Es ist ein sehr kinderfreundliches Hotel und auch so...

"Es ist ein sehr kinderfreundliches Hotel und auch so ausgestattet. Ein super Früstücksbüfett, die Lage ist super.Das Schwimmbad einzigartig, die Kinder wollten nicht mehr aus dem Wasser.Kostenloser Busshattel, worauf man nicht lange warten musste. Es gab Probleme, sprachlich zu verstehen. Es wurde aber zu einem nächstmöglichen Zeitpunkt eine Dolmetscherin bestellt, die uns genauestens etwas zu unseren geplanten Ausflügen sagen konnte.Immer wieder!"

- 23/06/2015 -

Nähe zu Disneyland

"Nähe zu Disneyland Shuttlebus gratis Für Kinder idealErlebnishallenbad"

- 08/06/2015 -

Das Personal war nett und hilfsbereit, die Zimmerausstattung...

- 19/06/2018 -

Parfait week-end en famille.

"Globalement très heureux (parents et enfants) de notre week-end. L’hôtel a très bien correspondu à mes attentes: Petite échappée pas loin de Paris où nous vivons, avec piscine et jeux pour les enfants. Et j’oubliais la salle de jeux arcades et le ciné 6D mais nous n’avons pu en profiter. Pas assez de temps. Pas loin de Disney.La chambre très bien conçue du fait de la separation wc-sdb, une chambre enfant séparée, literie super confortable, les aires de jeux et la piscine sont un gros bon point pour les familles qui, si elles doivent rester plusieurs jours pourront s’occuper au sein de l’hôtel. Possibilité de rajouter un lit parapluie. Les espaces verts extérieurs: superbes et relaxants, bien entretenus. Hôtel très propre, piscine très propre. Possibilité de garder la chambre plus longtemps : à régler biensûr. 10€/heure. Parfait pour les familles.Très bonne alternative aux Hôtels Disney niveau prix.Très bon rapport qualité prix."

- 10/05/2018 -

A refaire sans hésiter!

"Rapport qualité prix au rendez vous. Personnel aimable de l'accueil, en passant par les activités et le restaurant. Piscine au top pour les enfants (non surveillée), mis à disposition de brassard, bouée et jouets au bord de piscine. Restaurant buffet "classique" mais suffisant : choix entrée, plat, fromage, dessert, boissons pour 22e. Petit déjeuner buffet classique également mais copieux, beaucoup de choix. Reassort constant lorsque les plats se vident. Je conseille vivement pour les familles avec enfant. Navette pour Disney très disponible à tout moment. (Appli Flash code pour connaître horaire en direct).parking gratuit spacieux."

- 29/04/2018 -

Bon rapport qualité-prix.

"Hôtel proche de Disney, parking de l'hôtel et service de navettes pouvant aller à Disney = gratuits. Notre tarif comprenait la chambre (propreté correcte mais pas parfaite!), les petits-déjeuners (buffet copieux et à volonté) ainsi que le parking de Disney (gratuit au lieu de 25 euros) , en somme bon rapport qualité-prix. L'ensemble est satisfaisant pour le prix proposé, piscine assez petite mais agréable tout de même. Aire de jeux intérieurs très sympa pour les enfants pendant que les parents peuvent se restaurer."

- 29/04/2018 -

À refaire, voire mieux que les hôtels Disney....

"Lits parfaits, surtout les lits superposés qui ont beaucoup plu aux enfants. En plus, j'ai pu bénéficier du menu enfant (avec certificat médical suite à un by-pass). Ce que les hôtels Disney n'acceptent pas. Et enfin, petit déjeuner compris dans le prix !"

- 29/11/2017 -

Un séjour plutôt agréable pour un prix raisonnable, je conseille surtout cet hôtel aux familles dont

"La chambre était très bien aménagée. Nous n'étions qu'un couple mais il y avait également deux autres lits simples superposés pour des enfants.Nous avons pu profiter de la petite piscine intérieure après une journée au parc (l'eau n'était cependant pas très chaude et les douches glaciales).En revanche, le personnel est très accueillant et serviable. La navette gratuite (toutes les 15-20mn, comptez 5mn pour aller sur le parc et 20mn pour le retour du soir) et l'accès gratuit au parking Disney sont très appréciables.Nous avons choisi de dîner au restaurant La Plantation qui propose un buffet à volonté pour environ 25€ par personne avec boisson sans alcool à volonté. Le prix reste très abordable et l'on s'attend bien sûr à des plats assez industriels mais tout de même bon."

C'est un hôtel familial proche de Disneyland Paris.

"C'est un hôtel familial proche de Disneyland Paris. L'ambiance y est chouette. Il y a de nombreuses occupations pour les enfants : piscine avec jeux, modules de jeux intérieurs et extérieurs. Petit déjeuner compris et très correct : viennoiseries , pain, charcuterie et fromage, fruits frais , yaourts confitures, boissons chaudes et froides. Il y a moyen de se restaurer convenablement et à prix pas trop élevé au soir (offre très restreinte de sandwiches le midi), nous avons mangé de la pizza et nos avons aussi pris le buffet à volonté. La navette est très pratique aussi."

- 29/09/2017 -

Bon rapport qualité/prix, idéal pour un séjour à Eurodisney

"L'hôtel est super pour les familles! Nous avons été bien accueilli et conseiller à la réception. La déco est chouette, chambre mignonne et propre, chambre demandée pour 4, reçu une chambre à 6 lits. La literie est bonne. Environnement calme. L'accès est aisé au parc Disney en navette, très pratique. La piscine est de taille satisfaisante, notre fils de 7ans s'y est bien défoulé et la plaine de jeux intérieure a amusé notre petite de 2,5ans. Petit déjeuner basique mais correct. Pour info, nous avions oublié de l'argent dans notre coffre fort, quand nous les avons appelé 3h après notre Check out, ils ont pu nous récupérer cet argent (montant intact) et le garder précieusement jusqu'à notre sortie tardive du parc (21h), ça vaut la peine d'être souligné car tous les établissements ne sont pas aussi honnêtes"

Un vrai paradis pour les enfants

A l'hôtel, le petit déjeuner est varié et copieux car à volonté. Les chambres sont très bien conçues, mes filles ont adoré les lits superposés, très solides , de très bonne qualité,avec des rebords hauts , ce qui est sécurisant pour les petits ( ma dernière fille a 5 ans). L'hôtel propose une piscine qui est top, et les alentours de l'hotel sont verdoyants, cela est très reposants.Je terminerai par les mots de ma fille " Maman, je vais rester ici pour toujours""

- 26/02/2017 -

Hotel Familliale, excellent rapport qualité prix à moins de 10min du parc Disney.

"Parking proche et grand. Air de déchargement devant l'hôtel énorme, navette gratuite hôtel parc d'attraction toutes les 7-25min, beaucoup de navettes entre 9h et 10h30 ainsi que le soir à la fermeture (premier à entrer à l'hôtel et premier à descendre en rentrant du parc)Petit déjeuner bien varié, pensez à venir entre 7h et 8h30 après trop de monde et certains produits plus réapprovisionés (jambon par exemple).Restaurant, bar et piscine faciles d'accès, propres, personnel souriant très professionnel.Happy Hour au bar 19-20h un acheté le 2ème gratuit.Salle de jeux vidéo avec pas mal de borne de tir arcade (pas de flipper).Piscine ouverte de 8 à 23h (fermée entre 11h et 17h)3 toboggans dont un très haut (sur 2 étages avec feu de régulation)Chambre confortable, WC séparé de la salle de bain, sèche cheveux et baignoire opérationnels et propres, eau chaude rapidement. Température de la chambre parfaite période d'hiver) présence d'un ventilateur fonctionel au dessus du lit pour ventiler en été (attention très près du lit superposé).Vue sur le parc de l'hôtel avec bateau piratent plan d'eau.Chambre au de celui du rez-de-chaussée et réception) prise à 14h, parfait. Sol en moquette dans pratiquement tout l'hôtel (et chambre) en excellent de propreté."

- 17/12/2016 -

pas mal avec les enfants.

Chambre (pour 6) pas très grande avec une pièce séparée avec deux lits superposés qui sont plutôt destinés aux enfants. Toilettes et salle de bains séparés. Petit déjeuner très copieux. Piscine ouverte très tard et tôt. Literie correcte. Réception super agréable et efficace. Personnel piscine adorable. Serviettes louées 2 euros à la piscine."

Je recommande, l'accueil et espace piscine super pour les enfants et leurs parents

"- l'accueil, le personnel de l'hôtel dans son ensemble +++la décoration de l'hôtel et des chambres, au top pour les petits moussaillons- l'espace piscine, génial et propre. Les tailles des cabines très adaptées à une utilisation familiale - bref, un super hotel pour les enfants et leurs parents- Même si ce n'est pas beaucoup mis en avant par Booking il faut savoir que lorsque l'on séjourne dans cet hôtel, le parking Disney est gratuit sur présentation de la réservation (ou des clés de l'hotel) = 20€ d'économies tout de même !"

- 03/11/2016 -

Un paradis pour les enfants

"Les croissants et pains au chocolat étaient très bons au petit déjeuner. Le repas du soir au restaurant Plantation à 25€/personne est varié et très bon. Il y a de nombreux plats proposés le meme soir : agneau, poulet mariné, ragoût de bœuf, poisson...Le personnel de réception et du restaurant est très agréable. La piscine à toboggan est vraiment un gros plus, de même que son aire de jeu à balles. Mon fils a adoré. L'établissement vous prête des serviettes pour la piscine pour 2€ pour tout le séjour. Un distributeur vend également des brassards si vous les oubliez.Les chambres sont bien insonorisées.Navette joignant l'hôtel à Disney toutes les 10min environ et le trajet n'est que de 5min."

- 20/09/2016 -

Séjour magique

"Notre séjour à l'hôtel c'est très bien passé, la piscine y est ai agréable, dommage que le bateau ouvre qu'à 17h car nous n'avons pas pu en profiter. La chambre est superbe, les enfants ont adoré, le buffet est très bon avec pleins de choix ( juste un peu cher pour les enfants car mon fils de 4 ans qui ne mange casi rien à payer le même prix). Les jeux d'intérieur sont sympa mais si les parents faisaient plus attention a leurs enfants ça sera encore mieux, car des grands qui bousculent tout le temps les plus petit ça énerve. Le personnel est très aimable et toujours disponible. Merci on reviendra."

- 08/08/2016 -

Excellent hôtel partenaire de Disneyland Paris

"Je ne compte plus les séjour que nous avons fait à l'hôtel Explorers, car on y revient avec assiduité. Et c'est toujours notre premier choix quand on souhaite passer la nuit à Disneyland Paris, pour nous éviter l'aller-retour dans la journée. Et le parc aquatique est l'un des motifs qui fait la différence, mes enfants y s'éclatent!!! Mais pas le seul: le confort et la décoration des chambres, l'air de jeux, le resto à pizza, le buffet du dîner, le petit déjeuner à volonté et la navette (avec une très bonne fréquence) pour Disney sont des points très positifs."

- 07/08/2016 -

Super pour les enfants grâce aux aires de jeux multiples et...

"Super pour les enfants grâce aux aires de jeux multiples et variées et la piscine. Par contre l'attraction principale de la piscine est fermée de 11h à 17h du coup nous n'avons pas pu en profiter... Mon petit garçon était déjà ravi des toboggans mais j'étais déçue pour lui. Pour les parents ce n'est pas du tout reposant car les enfants disparaissent en un instant d'une attraction à l'autre. Mais ils sont heureux alors si l'on accepte le deal c'est super ! On prolonge les étoiles et la magie de Disney par cet hôtel."

- 07/08/2016 -

"La mia esperienza si basa su di una permanenza riguardante il periodo invernale dal 30-11 al 3-12 2017.La colazione era ricchissima e di vastissima scelta, la struttura è vasta e contenuta allo stesso tempo e dopo una giornata indimenticabile al parco Disney la magia continua con la bellissima piscina e la zona ristoro dove puoi rilassarti e fare giocare i bambini nell' area dedicata e ci sono anche il cinema 6D e sala giochi.Camera con letto a castello molto spaziosa ed accogliente, tv 32 pollici a schermo piatto.Riscaldamento molto funzionale, in bagno termo elettrico aggiuntivo, letti comodissimi con piumino molto confortevole, pulita e corredata di ottimi asciugamani e dosatore con buonissimo doccia/shampoo.Consiglio per chi sia abituato o ne abbia estremamente bisogno, di portarsi o procurarsi il balsamo per i capelli.Personale molto cordiale di tutti i reparti, bar, reception, piscina, addetti alle pulizie e alle camere...Navetta satellitare con orario di arrivo in hotel precisissimo, bancomat, distributori automatici, non manca nulla.Se si arriva prima dell' orario del check-in,si ha la possibilità di lasciare i bagagli in un apposita stanza con armadietti elettronici con posto per 4 bagagli a mano per armadietto e cominciare a godersi l' hotel e tutti i suoi confort in tutta tranquillità.OTTIMO HAPPY HOUR dalle 20:00 alle 21:00 con paghi 1 e bevi 2.Per quanto mi riguarda è l' hotel più bello e completo della zona.Un peccato dover partire."

- 13/03/2017 -

Un paradiso per i bambini 😊🎉😉

"Sono rimasta contentissima di questo hotel!! Ottima posizione a neanche 10 minuti dai parchi Disney e collegato a loro da navette gratuite. La struttura è bellissima, pulita ed renderebbe felicissimo qualsiasi bambino grazie ad un meraviglioso acquaparco, parco giochi e un sacco di attenzioni e particolari adatti ai giovani clienti. Camera accogliente e dotata di tutti i confort. All'interno c'è una pizzeria, un ristorante a self service e un ristorante alla carte e con un 30 euro si mangia in due. Personale gentilissimo, attento e preparato per ogni esigenza. Parlano diverse lingue. Dispone di deposito bagagli e navette o taxi x raggiungere gli aeroporti/stazioni. Distributori bevande/snack ai piani (un po' caretti come prezzi). In ogni camera pratico bollitore e mini frigo. Lo raccomanderei senza dubbio!!! 10 e lode 😊"

- 14/06/2015 -

L' Hotel è molto carino ed è tutto incentrato sul tema...

"L' Hotel è molto carino ed è tutto incentrato sul tema dell'esplorazione.Ma la cosa più importante è che è molto organizzato per far divertire i bambini.Le mie figlie si sono molto divertite a giocare in piscina e con gli altri giochi che la struttura offre. C'è anche un piccolo cinema 6D molto divertente. E' a pagamento, ma vale la pena di provarlo con i vostri figli.Il mangiare non è il massimo, ma si può trovare anche di peggio al giro. Vi consiglio il ristorante a buffet perché si paga una cifra e potete mangiare e bere quello che vi pare e quanto vi pare. Poi per i bambini è sicuramente la soluzione migliore.Nell' Hotel si trova anche una boutique Disney dove poter comprare qualche souvenir all'ultimo minuto.C'é poi la navetta per i parchi Disney che si ferma ogni 15 minuti nel parcheggio dell' Hotel.Consiglio a tutti l' Explorers Hotel, soprattutto a chi vuole far passare un soggiorno divertente e originale ai propri figli."

- 29/09/2015 -

Decoração do hotel, muito gira para crianças.

"Decoração do hotel, muito gira para crianças. Piscina interior e espaços bons para os mais pequenos brincarem. Pessoal muito simpático e prestável. Há alguns que falam português. Os quartos têm aquecimento. Fica próximo da Disney, +/- a 5 minutos de carro. Não usámos o autocarro deles, levámos carro alugado do aeroporto. O hotel oferece estacionamento para o carro na Disney, que custa 15 € por dia. Basta levar o cartão de entrada do hotel."

- 24/09/2015 -

A localização é excelente.

"A localização é excelente. Há autocarros com regularidade, contudo a ocupação destes leva-nos a considerar a máxima" Salve-se quem puder", devido à lotação dos mesmos. Quartos confortáveis, em particular as camas. Piscina interior agradável para pais e crianças. Rapidez do check in e out."

- 19/07/2015 -

"Tem um espaço fantástico para os miúdos brincarem, desde a piscina ao parque de diversões, eles adoram. O hotel fornece shuttle regular para a Disney que fica a cerca de 5min. O hotel tem 2 restaurantes, jantámos na pizzeria que não é cara tendo em conta que é no hotel."

Loja de souvenires no interior e restaurantes com preços acessiveis. Transfer para a disney que passa de 10/10m ou de 25/25m. Qualidade preço muito boa, uma recepção e atendimento simpáticos e prestáveis. Para regressar certamente!!"

Políticas de Alojamiento

Children and Extra Beds
All children are welcome.
Extra beds are not available.
There is no capacity for extra beds in the room.
